alert.note: Alert for Colfax; Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 4:31PM MDT until August 16 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN COLFAX AND NORTH CENTRAL MORA COUNTIES... At 431 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated the thunderstorms that produced heavy rainfall have weakened. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.50 inches are possible in the warned area due to light to moderate rain. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Rayado and Ocate Creek basins. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose material. HAZARD...Previous heavy to intense rainfall over the burn scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses will persist. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ocate and Rayado. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cooks Peak fire burn area. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
